measurement_verification_system.title: Determining Savings in Climate Control Systems
measurement_verification_system.abstract: The method and device of the disclosure can determine energy or cost savings of a climate control system, such as can be attributed to a treatment that has been incorporated into a climate control system. The methods enable accurate measurement of treatment benefits without being affected by various variables like weather or occupancy changes.

dx_systems.description: Direct Exchange HVACR Systems (RTUs, split systems, CRAC units)
methodology: Pretreatment and post-treatment capacity determination using enthalpy differences across evaporator coils
Measurement of wet bulb temperatures entering and leaving the evaporator
Calculation of system efficacy (watts per ton ratios)
Normalization of post-treatment data to account for weather variations
Efficacy measured as power consumption divided by cooling load
Adjustment of post-treatment amperage based on outside air and condenser water temperature changes
Load calculation using chiller water flow and temperature differential

key_innovations: Enthalpy-based capacity calculations for accurate before/after comparison
Weather and occupancy normalization - results isolated from environmental variables
Real-time efficacy monitoring via voltage, amperage, and power factor measurements
kW/ton efficiency metric calculation with weather adjustment
Computing device with evaluation interfaces for automated data analysis

primary_claims: Methods determining pretreatment/post-treatment capacity via enthalpy difference measurements
Efficacy calculations using voltage, amperage, and power factor measurements
Normalized post-treatment efficacy accounting for weather conditions
Energy cost projections with treatment-induced capacity improvements
Computing device with evaluation interfaces for data analysis
